title: Woman loses 10st and drops EIGHT dress sizes after doctors warned her she’d struggle to conceive if she kept up her takeaway habit
text:
Mrs Crunch ‘My weight nearly stopped me having kids’ Woman loses 10st and drops EIGHT dress sizes after doctors warned her she’d struggle to conceive if she kept up her takeaway habit 
Doctors issued the stark warning after Rebecca suffered a tragic miscarriage By SOPHIE ROBERTS Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A WOMAN bid to change her life after doctors warned her that her weight could affect her fertility. 
Rebecca McCabe ditched her £260-a-month takeaway habit… and shifted an incredible TEN STONE in the process. HotSpot Media Rebecca began struggling with her weight when she was in secondary school 
The 26-year-old revealed that she struggled with her weight from a young age. 
In secondary school, she was cruelly taunted by her classmates because of her size 16 body. 
She said: “I had to deal with taunts of ‘fatty’ in the playground. 
“It got me down and I’d eat my lunch in the school library just to get away from it all.” HotSpot Media Her relationship with food worsened as she had problems in her previous marriage 
Even though her mum Hazel, 65, tried to encourage her to exercise, Rebecca kept on gaining weight. 
In 2013, she tipped the scales at 19 stone and was a size 20 when she tied the knot with her now ex-husband. 
As Rebecca struggled to cope with the unhappy aspects of her relationship, she sought comfort in food. 
She explained: “I was depressed and I used food to make myself feel better. 
“We’d order Chinese takeaway twice a week. 
“Each time, I’d have a portion of rice, chow mein, two starters, curry chips, a bag of prawn crackers and two dishes of chicken balls. 
“I was eating over 2,000 calories with each meal, and spending £30 a time.” HotSpot Media Rebecca piled on the pounds as she binged on takeaways twice a week HotSpot Media 10 Rebecca was mortified when someone asked her when the baby was due… when she wasn’t even pregnant 
Her £3,000 a year takeaway habit affected more than just her bank balance, as by 2014 her weight had risen to 21 stone. 
As Rebecca snacked on chocolate and crisps in between meals, she confessed she was “mortified” when she was once mistaken for being PREGNANT. 
The Hereford superslimmer recalled: “I remember working at Tie Rack when a customer came into the shop. 
“She smiled at me and asked me when the baby was due. 
“I was so mortified I just blushed and turned away.” HotSpot Media After suffering a tragic miscarriage, Rebecca was encouraged to start eating healthier by doctors HotSpot Media Remarkably, she’s shifted an incredible 10 stone since starting her new healthy regime 
After breaking up with her husband in 2014, Rebecca fell pregnant after a short fling. 
Tragically, when the mum-to-be miscarried 13 weeks later, she felt distressed at the thought that her weight could have been a contributing factor. 
She said: “I was devastated when I found out I had miscarried. 
“And a further blow came when I went to visit my doctor to find out why I lost my baby. 
“He told me that he was concerned about my BMI, which was 50.4. 
“At 5ft 4in and 21st, I was officially classed as obese. 
“He said that if I wanted to start a family in the future, I needed to lose more weight.” HotSpot Media Hannah and her mum Hazel both attend Slimming World classes together 
In 2015, Rebecca bid to change her life and embarked on a strict diet plan. 
She ditched takeaways for healthy home-cooked meals and started walking three miles to work every day. 
Staggeringly, in less than a year, Rebecca had lost six stone. HotSpot Media Ryan Layton, now 39, and Rebecca McCabe, now 26, pictured in December 2015, after she had lost 5st 13lbs HotSpot Media 10 Rebecca and Ryan have taken up hiking together, which keeps the loved-up couple slim and fit 
After falling head over heels for factory worker Ryan Layton in 2015, 15st Rebecca decided to join Slimming World. 
Within the first week, she had lost 7lbs, and has lost a further four stone since. 
Now Rebecca weighs in at a healthy 10st 3lbs and is a trim size eight. Related Stories What a gem! Along with Ryan, she has started hiking – and has even climbed Welsh mountains Snowdon and Sugar Loaf. 
Rebecca revealed: “Looking back at how big I was, where I am now is a huge achievement. 
“I’m in control of my life now and I am so proud of myself. 
“I’m looking forward to my future now. 
“I’m healthier than I’ve ever been and I intend to make the most of it.” HotSpot Media Rebecca has admitted that she feels much more in control of her life since shedding the pounds 
Rebecca isn’t the only superslimmer to undergo a jaw-dropping transformation in recent months.
